revised_title: Shapes and Stability of Captive Rotating Drops: A Finite Element Analysis
tldr: This article presents a finite element analysis to study the shapes and stability of captive rotating drops. The authors develop an algorithm to calculate equilibrium shapes and stability of three-dimensional menisci, focusing on rigidly rotating liquid held captive between two parallel, circular, solid faces co-rotating about their common axis. The findings have implications for the float-zone process of refining molten materials and producing single crystals.
